info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 1:24AM EDT until June 17 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Montgomery.
* WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 AM EDT, A rapid river rise has occurred along the South Fork of the Roanoke River near Shawsville due to rainfall of between 1 and 3 inches. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Roanoke River. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shawsville and Crockett Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
